article: in this video you ll see best places to visit in rome plus two bonus tips at the end of the video and don t forget to like this video and subscribe to our channel the suggestions are based on our several exciting trips to rome here are our top

number circus maximus circus maximus is an ancient roman chariot racing stadium and mass entertainment venue it was the first and largest stadium in ancient rome it could accommodate over spectators the site is now a public park number colosseum colosseum is the largest amphitheater ever built and it s

of concrete and stone construction was completed in the year it was designed to accommodate an estimated visitors it was used for gladiatorial contests public spectacles animal hunts executions reenactments of famous battles and dramas based on classical mythology earthquakes over time caused great damage to the structure number roman

roman forum is a forum surrounded by the ruins of several important ancient government buildings right next to the colosseum forum was the center of day to day life in rome for example elections processions criminal trials public speeches and commercial affairs were held there the roman forum developed organically

many centuries number altar of the fatherland altar of the fatherland is a monument built in honor of the first king of unified italy victor emmanuel this largest monument in rome was controversial since its construction destroyed a large part of the hill and the medieval neighborhood the terrace of

building offers an amazing panoramic view of rome number pantheon pantheon is a former roman temple and is now a church it is the best preserved ancient roman monument the word pantheon is a greek adjective meaning honor all gods the occulus in the center of the building is the

source of natural light it truly is a majestic building number trevi fountain trevi fountain is one of the most famous fountains in the world the legend says that whoever drinks the water from the fountain or throws a coin in it will ensure his return to rome no wonder

were in rome all the time number spanish steps spanish steps are a monumental stairway of steps that were built in the th century by a french diplomat who wanted to connect spanish embassy and the trinita de monte church as the widest stairway in europe it quickly became one

the major roman attractions every spring part of the steps are covered in flowers number villa borghese villa borghese is a landscape garden containing several buildings and villas museums and other attractions in they began turning this former vineyard into extensive gardens the park was remade to its current form

the th century in english style the city of rome later bought the property and turned it into a public park number castle sant angelo castle sant angelo was initially commissioned by the roman emperor hadrian as the mausoleum for himself and his family this extraordinary round shaped building was

used by the popes as a fortress and a castle and is now a museum it lays just outside vatican city number vatican although vatican city is an independent state since it is located within rome vatican has been the residence of the pope since don t forget to visit

peter s square and basilica if you want to see the vatican museums where you ll also see the sistine chapel be sure to enter from a different street it is absolutely worth seeing number piazza navona whoa wait aren t you guys doing top yeah true but since rome

such a special place it deserves one more piazza navona is a square located in the heart of rome it is built on dominitian s ancient stadium and it s surrounded by beautiful renaissance and baroque buildings and it features magnificent fountains and here are the two bonus tips that

promised bonus number pyramid of cestius did you know that rome has its own pyramid over years old pyramid of cestius is an ancient pyramid that lays next to porta san paulo the ancient gates to the city of rome it was built for as a tomb for gaio cestio

a member of the epulones religious corporation since the pyramid is open to public only on certain days bonus number the mouth of truth the mouth of truth is a marble mask in rome it probably depicts the face of a sea god historians aren t quite certain what the

purpose of the disk was but the legend says that if you lie when you place your hand inside it the mouth will cut your hand plus an extra super super bonus villa d este villa d este is a th century villa in the town of tivoli approximately minute

from rome famous for its terraced hillsides italian renaissance garden and especially for its profusion of fountains it is now an italian state museum and it s listed as a unesco world heritage site of course there are many other things to see in rome such as baths of caracalla

del popolo tiber island and many more we created a google map with all these suggestions check the description below if you like this video give it a big thumbs up and don t forget to subscribe to our channel we upload new videos every wednesday ciao
abstract: 👉Check out our Top Things to Do in ITALY in 2019: https://youtu.be/Xnor9UuIBNg 🇮🇹😀

I followed this video while in Rome
Day 1 
Spanish Steps
Trione Fountain
Trevi Fountain
Pantheon
Piazza Navona
Vittariono
Palazzo Venezia

Days 2 
Vatican Museums
St. Peters Basilica (climbed the dome as well)
Castle St Angelo 
Piazzale Garibaldi (sunset)
Trastevere (dinner)

Day 3
Colosseum
Roman Forum
Palatine Hill
Santa Maria Maggiore
Piazza Della Republica

Thanks a lot for this video, the maps and interactive information helped me a great deal !

I have watched countless videos about Rome in preparation for my honeymoon this summer. This was hands down the most well made & informative video I watched. Thank you so much for these lovely resources, and unique spots that aren’t on every list.
